conclusion: Understanding what a velocity-time graph represents.
Slope of the graph gives acceleration; positive slope means accelerating.
Linear motion means moving in a straight line.
Gradually decreasing acceleration means acceleration is becoming smaller over time.
Velocity is positive and curve is leveling off from 1 to 2 seconds.
Red tangent lines show slope is steeper at earlier times and less steep towards 2 seconds.
Acceleration is decreasing from 1 to 2 seconds based on slope analysis.
Velocity is 20 m/s at t=1 and 15 m/s at t=2.
Acceleration is negative from 1 to 2 seconds as velocity decreases.
Acceleration changes sign from positive to negative between 1 and 2 seconds.
Acceleration is decreasing from a positive value to a negative value.
